channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why We Love to Believe That Our Names Shape Our Destinies
item.description: The weird, mostly bad science of nominative determinism.

item.title: Edmundo González, Opposition Candidate, Flees Venezuela
item.description: Vice President Delcy Rodríguez said on social media that Edmundo González had left for Spain, whose foreign minister said Mr. González was traveling o...

item.title: Greece to crack down on short-term rentals and levy port fees amid overtourism
item.description: The country will also expand its so-called “Golden Visa” program to investors who are willing to put at least $277,000 into local startups.

item.title: Brazil’s X Ban Upended Digital Businesses Overnight
item.description: The ban on Elon Musk’s X has dealt a blow to Brazilians whose livelihoods depended on internet followings they had amassed for years, and which disapp...

item.title: Janet Yellen still sees a soft landing despite latest disappointing jobs report
item.description: Monthly job gains are at about the level needed to absorb new entrants to the labor market, Yellen said.

item.title: What We Know About the Apalachee High School Shooting
item.description: A teenager is accused of killing two students and two teachers in the deadliest school shooting in Georgia’s history. His father was arrested, too.

item.title: In Rural China, ‘Sisterhoods’ Demand Justice, and Cash
item.description: Growing numbers of Chinese women are challenging a longstanding tradition that denies them village membership, and the lucrative payouts that go with ...

item.title: Donald Trump threatens 100% tariff on countries that turn away from the dollar
item.description: “You leave the dollar and you’re not doing business with the United States because we are going to put a 100% tariff on your goods."

item.title: Kuwait Turns to Power Cuts as Climate Change Strains Its Grid
item.description: The Persian Gulf nation has instituted rolling blackouts to cope with surging summer electricity demand, stirring frustration among citizens.

item.title: U.S. believes Iran sent ballistic missiles to Russia for its war on Ukraine
item.description: "This partnership threatens European security and illustrates how Iran’s destabilizing influence reaches beyond the Middle East and around the world.”

item.title: Russia’s strategy to rely more China’s yuan is backfiring
item.description: "We cannot lend in yuan because we have nothing to cover our foreign currency positions with."
